alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 13 at 6:31AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 930 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 629 AM HST, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain over the eastern side of the Big Island south of Laupahoehoe. Rain was falling at a rate of up to 1 inch per hour. Honolii Stream has risen steadily over the last several hours in response. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Mountain View, Keaau, Glenwood, Hawaiian Acres, Orchidland Estates, Volcano, Papaikou, Pepeekeo, Pahoa, Honomu, Hakalau, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Ninole, Laupahoehoe, Kurtistown, Fern Acres and Wainaku. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 930 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
